intro: Ophrys × ragusana nothosubsp. luisae, commonly known as the Luisa orchid, is a rare hybrid orchid species native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the genus Ophrys, which is characterized by its intricate flower structures that mimic female insects to attract male pollinators. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas and prefers moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually yellow or brown with intricate patterns that aid in mimicry. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
